LayoutNode.Content: Manage Your Business
LayoutNode.SRC: Manage Your Business

LayoutNode.Content: The Chase guide to business disaster resiliency
LayoutNode.SRC: The Chase guide to business disaster resiliency

LayoutNode.Content: By Cybele Weisser Posted: 06/27/18 Updated: 10/15/18
LayoutNode.SRC: By Cybele WeisserPosted: 06/27/18 Updated: 10/15/18

LayoutNode.Content: Large-scale disasters are rare. Yet it's critical that business owners create a solid plan for how they can avoid getting hit—either by a natural disaster like a hurricane or fire, or a human-created onesuch as a cyberattack. According to the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), almost 40 percent of small businesses don't recover from disasters. That makes sense when youconsider that it only takes one serious weather event, or accidental exposure to a hacker, to lose critical data, systems or your businesses' good reputation among customers—a setback that couldtake months, if not years, to rebuild.
LayoutNode.SRC: Large-scale disasters are rare. Yet it's critical that business owners create a solid plan for how they can avoid getting hit—either by a natural disaster like a hurricane or fire, or a human-created one such as a cyberattack. According to the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), almost 40 percent of small businesses don't recover from disasters. That makes sense when you consider that it only takes one serious weather event, or accidental exposure to a hacker, to lose critical data, systems or your businesses' good reputation among customers—a setback that could take months, if not years, to rebuild.

LayoutNode.Content: With that said, some disasters, especially weather-driven ones, are impossible to avoid. That's why you also need a recovery strategy, for the event that the unthinkable hits.
LayoutNode.SRC: With that said, some disasters, especially weather-driven ones, are impossible to avoid. That's why you also need a recovery strategy, for the event that the unthinkable hits.

LayoutNode.Content: Let the articles below serve as a roadmap to create the best possible disaster preparation and recovery plan for your business.
LayoutNode.SRC: Let the articles below serve as a roadmap to create the best possible disaster preparation and recovery plan for your business.

LayoutNode.Content: Help your business bounce back after a disaster
LayoutNode.SRC: Help your business bounce back after a disaster

LayoutNode.Content: The time immediately following a natural disaster can feel overwhelming. Here's how to spring quickly into action and take advantage of the resources available to help.
LayoutNode.SRC: The time immediately following a natural disaster can feel overwhelming. Here's how to spring quickly into action and take advantage of the resources available to help.

LayoutNode.Content: 4 ways to keep your business data safe
LayoutNode.SRC: 4 ways to keep your business data safe

LayoutNode.Content: A cyber breach can be devastating. Follow these steps to ensure you've properly secured your company's data.
LayoutNode.SRC: A cyber breach can be devastating. Follow these steps to ensure you've properly secured your company's data.

LayoutNode.Content: The best ways to support your workers through a disaster
LayoutNode.SRC: The best ways to support your workers through a disaster

LayoutNode.Content: Some of the best ways to support your workers post-disaster don't demand additional personnel, or large expenses. Here's how to make sure your support plan covers the three key areas.
LayoutNode.SRC: Some of the best ways to support your workers post-disaster don't demand additional personnel, or large expenses. Here's how to make sure your support plan covers the three key areas.

LayoutNode.Content: How to help your business survive a disaster 4 ways to keep your business data safe How to support your workers through a disaster
Cybele Weisser is a Chase News senior editor. Her work has appeared in Money magazine and The Wall Street Journal.
LayoutNode.SRC: Cybele Weisser is a Chase News senior editor. Her work has appeared in Money magazine and The Wall Street Journal.
